bibl.author: Nicholas D. Palmer
bibl.title: Nicholas D. Palmer to Walt Whitman, 24 June 1865

revisionDesc.change: errors in transcription ("Lewis" for "Louisville," "88" for "80" and "immediately" for "amediately")fixed; note for Palmer updated
Compared Transcription to Manuscript Image and Made Corrections

body.p:
I concluded I would talk a few words to you through this instrument. I am well and hope the safe arrival of this may find you the same. There is not much talk of theVetterans getting out yet: if you have any thing in the way of advice to give concerning my imployment when I am Discharged talk plain to me Mr. Whitman. I have been about the world more perhaps than you would imagine there are a great many
cruel turns and there a variety of ways of making a liveing. Leaving hard work out of the Books, and I have thought that were bigger fools than me making a living very Easy although I admit my Education is Limited. Name any thing you Please and if I Do not Propose to accept: that is as far as it will Go I will blow on no one. What about Such houses as we were talking about and if it Should be made agreeable for me to take up Lodgeing in Close Proximity with yours. I Should be Pleased in the Superlative Degree. Please write amediately immediately after you receive this and Give me Some
advice No matter what sort. I conclude.
Hopeing to hear from you soon. Until then.

closer.salute:
I remain your Friend
as Ever
closer.signed:
Nicholas D. Palmer Co. E. 80th Regt. 0.1.1.
1st Brig 2nd Division
15th A
